metadata.metaValue:
Takes an array of vertices representing a face and splits into mutiple faces as needed to prevent the face's area from exiting it's perimeter.

A normal is required for the reference point which should be computed if none is provided
Last we slice the array by the passed and failed sections. The passed sections are merged to form the new face. The remaining slices are reprocessed.

Slice fvs from the slice start -> current index

Shift this array in different ways typically reduces number of resulting faces for ngons with many sides. eg. not getting stuck on a root point thats in a valley.

There doesn't seem to be a particular shift that is best in all cases. The current solution is to shift up once ever other iteration.
Test each point if it can connect to the face's root point without exiting the face's perimeter
This tests if the ray starts out traveling within the face
Checks ray against all face edges for intersections
The first 2 and last point are a given
Edge does includes our ray's point? (these edges are handled by the 'starts_inside_check', so are a given pass)
edge is at a greater distance than the ray?
Both points on the same side of the ray?

Each iter we create a line/edge from the current and prev points and check if it intersects the ray.

An edge intersects if all checks are false, so if any are true we can continue without finishing.
Intersection point is outside of the ray
